If you think the HOLLYWEIRD (WEST COAST) crowd isn't watching then watch out! It's all along the lines of the "big Show" and "the show must go on". Any performance will be getting checked out by "that" crowd and some will even be working in those areas. My Grandmother lived in West Hollywood and she was an old trooper in the show business sense. My grandfather also worked in that industry as a cinematographer. It's influence is felt all around the world. In the years past it has been infiltrated even more by a perverse crowd who has their eyes on everything. I have seen these people close up and have heard some of their plans, don't be fooled. Putting a little girl in a WOMANS clothes and having her pose provocatively is setting her up for a real travesty. Frankly, I think any Mother should rethink ever putting makeup on any of these children and not just for the sake of making them less desirable for those pedophiles, but think about the health concerns involved when putting those products on a child that is still developing physically?
reply: What do you bet the mom's pushing their small daughters into these bizarre, little-girl beauty pageants would love nothing more than to be noticed by "Hollywood" ?
title: TV show called Little Miss Perfect

content: My aunt tried to get my brother to let his daughter when she was 6 or so to enter a beauty contest and be a little model. Joe, being of sound mind said not just no, but h377 NO. My neice is 30 years old now, two kids, and she is still a knock out and still thin! Her hub is cute too, lol.

content: With ALL of the “reality” shows that are coming out now days…some sicko in Hollywood had to find some way to save his J O B…and I guess (because I’ve never heard of this show) he’s found a market for it, sponsors and some type of fan-base to keep it on air. Next, they will have cameras in the delivery room… Well no wonder I’ve never heard of it ( I had to Google it)…its on WE, and this channel does not contour to men. Sorry ladies…no offence! So, on my softer side…I do watch when “Army Wives” is on. I like the show, but I wish they would get better “technical advisors” for some of the cast members. Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!

content: Actually, it is a southern thing. I live out west and we do not have any beauty pageants in our city, and I know of no-one that would be interested in them. Maybe some modelling. All those pageants appear to be in Texas, Georgia etc. I believe they orginally started off as something to give your child confidence and self esteem, and now it has gone way way beyond that.
